title.narrative: Lokale productie Solar Soaker met spuitgieten

description.narrative: Startup Acacia Impact Innovation B.V. (Acacia) wants to contribute to a better world by developing innovations that have a major social impact. Acacia does this through advice and consultancy, developing business strategies, fundraising and public-private partnerships.Acacia recently developed the Solar Soaker, an affordable and simple alternative to the washing machine. The Solar Soaker consists of a plastic tray with a transparent lid and uses the sun's heat to remove stains and dirt. In countries such as Uganda, women / girls spend an average of 16 hours per week doing laundry (by hand). The solar soaker offers them the opportunity to do their laundry efficiently, leaving much more time for a job or education. The solar soaker is also suitable for medical clinics, where hygiene is improved and the risk of infections is reduced. At the moment Acacia produces a (very) small number of washing machines in the Netherlands by means of thermoforming. This makes the product very expensive (EUR 75 each). With the solar soaker produced in the Netherlands, Acacia has recently been able to validate the Ugandan market for this product (pilot project TA / DGGF). Field tests have shown that the solution saves time (only 1/3 of the time needed), reduces physical effort by 90%, the laundry is cleaner, less water is used, etc. Acacia now wants to scale up. However, production costs will then have to be reduced. It is expected that injection molding in Uganda instead of thermoforming will reduce the production costs of the solar soaker to EUR 6 each. Acacia wants to collaborate with a the Ugandan company for local production.Acacia's approach is to create a network of laundries, especially in rural areas, run by micro-entrepreneurs. They rent the solar soakers and will offer the laundry service. Customers pay a minimal amount for the laundry.
